newsitem.title: CANADA: Gulf Canada sets US$158 mln share issue.
newsitem.headline: Gulf Canada sets US$158 mln share issue.

text.p: Gulf Canada Resources Ltd said on Wednesday it signed an underwriting agreement for the sale in Canada and the United States of 20 million ordinary shares at US$7.875 each.

Underwriters for the offering, being made to partially fund the company's proposed takeover of Britain's Clyde Petroleum Plc, include Goldman Sachs & Co, RBC Dominion Securities Inc, Salomon Brothers Inc and TD Securities Inc.
Gulf said the offering, which includes an option for the underwriters to buy an additional three million shares for over allotments, was expected to close on January 15.
The company said its ordinary shares outstanding would increase to about 265 million after the issue.

Public holdings would increase to 58 percent, and the balance would be held by banking consortium A&G Resources Corp and a group of institutional investors led by Houston-based Torch Energy Advisors Inc.

Gulf said that if its offer for Clyde was not successful, it would use the offering's proceeds to fund a portion of 1997 capital spending and for other general corporate purposes. ((-- Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
